pullRequest.title: Use AcmeHistory file to revoke the old certificate

nodes.bodyText: Probably should update the comment to say this uses the configured directory URI.
Update comment to explain this uses the configured directory URI.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -373,7 +374,7 @@ public void update_directoryURI_maxFileSize() throws Exception {
 
 			//Write 10 fake entries to the ACME file

nodes.bodyText: We repeat the tokenizing of this file in several methods. Can't we just have one method that reads the files, creates some simple pojo that contains the data, and then call that from all of these methods? I think that would make it much cleaner and reduce the number of places that have the same sort of code that we need to maintain.

Comment:
Check to see if the certificate is in the history file - it should be unless we are transitioning from self-signed to ACME. If the certificate isn't in the history file, use the configured directory URI.
Probably some debug indicating the certificate wasn't found in the history file.
Need javadoc... here and on methods.
Seems these return codes should be constants.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -99,23 +105,31 @@ protected boolean directoryURIChanged(String currentDirectoryURI, WsLocationAdmi
      *          2 if the file was not created

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't this logic just go in the writeAcmeFileLine method? can't we make this check there?
Whitespace. (for all methods in this class)
Do we use the set methods? Seems this should be an immutable class.
Check whether anytrace and debug is enabled before calling.
